message_1: Which of the following isotopes has a greater number of neutrons: carbon-12 or carbon-14?
message_2:
Carbon-14 has a greater number of neutrons. 

To determine the number of neutrons in an isotope, you subtract the atomic number (number of protons) from the mass number (sum of protons and neutrons). Carbon has an atomic number of 6.

For carbon-12:
Number of neutrons = mass number - atomic number = 12 - 6 = 6 neutrons

For carbon-14:
Number of neutrons = mass number - atomic number = 14 - 6 = 8 neutrons

Carbon-14 has 8 neutrons, which is greater than the 6 neutrons in carbon-12.
